comments.raw_text:
User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; rv:5.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/5.0
Build ID: 20110615151330

Steps to reproduce:

Release the mid-button over a picture.


Actual results:

It opens a tab from the pictures link.


Expected results:

There shouldn't be opened a new tab.

(The Problem existet also with text-links, but was solved with a newer release.)
Mouse: Razer Diamondback 3G (There's also another Problem, maybe have to do with this problem.)

comments.raw_text:
I can kinda confirm this on Linux with FF7a2 and MS Wireless Mobile Mouse 3500.
Steps:
1. midleclick on empty area
2. hold down button move mouse a bit until the scroll icon disappears.
3. move the mouse on the image with link (button still pressed)
4. move the mouse over the image slowlly, keeping the button pressed
5. notice new tabs are spawning with the URL, even without releasing the mouse and JS disabled.

Is this the same problem?
comments.text:

4. move the mouse over the image slowlly, keeping the button pressed

comments.author: cool_sch.alex@gmx.de
comments.raw_text: It's nearly same, I have to release the button over the image for the new tab (only one tab appears).
comments.text: It's nearly same, I have to release the button over the image for the new tab (only one tab appears).

comments.raw_text:
It seems to depend on the page. On the 2 links in comment 5 I get the behaviour I described - unlimited open tabs just by jittering the mouse over the image.

On e.g. https://support.mozilla.com/en-US/kb/Safe%20Mode it is harder, the new tab with link opens only after button release, as you describe. It is on the FF logo on the top. But it only happens if while moving the mouse over it and button is pressed I manage to get a focus ring around the image. Then the link opens, otherwise not.
comments.text:
It seems to depend on the page. On the 2 links in comment 5 I get the behaviour I described - unlimited open tabs just by jittering the mouse over the image.

On e.g. https://support.mozilla.com/en-US/kb/Safe%20Mode it is harder, the new tab with link opens only after button release, as you describe. It is on the FF logo on the top. But it only happens if while moving the mouse over it and button is pressed I manage to get a focus ring around the image. Then the link opens, otherwise not.
